description:
You know how the story goes: girl crushes on guy, girl confesses feelings to guy, guy mistakes confession for a job application. Okay, maybe that's not how it usually goes, but that's what happens when Chiyo Sakura finally gets up the nerve to tell her classroom crush Nozaki how she feels. Since she doesn't know that he's secretly a manga artist who publishes under a female pen name, and he doesn't know that she doesn't know, he misunderstands and offers her a chance to work as his assistant instead of a date! But while it's not flowers and dancing, it is a chance to get closer to him, so Chiyo gamely accepts. And when Nozaki realizes how useful Chiyo can be in figuring out what girls find romantic, he'll be spending even more time with her "researching" while remaining completely clueless. Could Chiyo's romantic frustration possibly get any more drawn out of proportion?

(Source: Sentai Filmworks)

tags.name: Parody
tags.description: Features deliberate exaggeration of popular tropes or a particular genre to comedic effect.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Drawing
tags.description: Centers around the art of drawing, including manga and doujinshi.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Unrequited Love
tags.description: One or more characters are experiencing an unrequited love that may or may not be reciprocated.

tags.name: Otaku Culture
tags.description: Centers around the culture of a fanatical fan-base.

tags.name: Work
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a certain occupation.

tags.name: Gender Bending
tags.description: Prominently features a character who dresses and behaves in a way characteristic of another gender, or has been transformed into a person of another gender.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Tomboy
tags.description: Features a girl who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of boys.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: School Club
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a school club scene.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Educational
tags.description: Primary aim is to educate the audience.

tags.name: Crossdressing
tags.description: Prominently features a character dressing up as the opposite sex.

title.native: 月刊少女野崎くん ミニOVA

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/tubakiidumi) | [Blog](http://camellia698.blog82.fc2.com/)

A Japanese manga artist. Her twin sister, [Yoshiki Koga](https://anilist.co/staff/113703), is also a mangaka.

Tsubaki was originally studying to become a teacher, but eventually decided to follow Koga instead, who was already working as a manga artist. After Tsubaki won third place in a contest, an editor approached her, and she has been working as a mangaka ever since. She has stated that her inspirations include her sister and [Yoshihiro Togashi](https://anilist.co/staff/96893/Yoshihiro-Togashi), as Togashi's _Yu Yu Hakusho_ series was the first manga Tsubaki bought on her own.

Website | Twitter Introduction Masayoshi Ooishi is a Japanese vocalist, lyricist, composer, arranger and guitarist. He is currently a lead vocalist and guitarist for the band Sound Schedule, which is a three-piece J-pop/rock/jazz band. He is also a part of the duo [OxT](https://anilist.co/staff/127401/OxT) (Ooishi x Tom-H@ck), with Oshima Tomohiro. Biography Since making his major debut as a vocalist and guitarist for the band Sound Schedule in 2001, he has left numerous works as a musician. His outstanding voice, which has revealed itself to be capable of touching the hearts of many, worldwide, and while having his performance evaluated by the people, as a part of a new band at the time, he got to appear on music-themed programs on TV, and on numerous unusual music stations, while also participating in festivals nationwide. In 2008, he made his solo debut as "Masayoshi Ooishi". His way of playing the acoustic guitar was said to be a masterpiece of its own, and as a solo artist to debut with that as a reputation, it made it all the more interesting for him. There are various ways to describe him as a musician, some call him a "hand magician", or a "one-person amusement park", some even say it's like watching a magic trick. Not only does he perform live at the country's floorboard, he also performs on the internet on sites such as YouTube and Nico Nico Douga, where he attracts lots of attention from all generations alike, but he's a lot more popular with the younger generation.
_Note: Not to be confused with the [animator](https://anilist.co/staff/149712/)._

**Birthplace:** Fukuoka Prefecture, Japan

**[Twitter](https://twitter.com/tah3gucci3cozy3)**

**Taguchi Kouji (田口浩司)** is a Japanese producer and animation planner for anime. 

He works at Square Enix as a senior executive manager for their publishing team, music publishing team, advertising team and their game development team.
_Note: Not to be confused with either the [animator](https://anilist.co/staff/157702/), or the [editor](https://anilist.co/staff/181541/) by the same name._
Affiliated with [Doga Kobo](https://anilist.co/studio/95/Doga-Kobo). Sparsely worked as a production assistant earlier in her career.

Affiliated with [Doga Kobo](https://anilist.co/studio/95/Doga-Kobo).

_Note: Not to be confused with [animator](https://anilist.co/staff/166224/)._

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/YukaliHashimoto) | [Blog (jp)](http://blog.livedoor.jp/marianne_amplifier/)

She is a composer, arranger and synthesizer programmer.

Originating from [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/). Known to prescore his works.

Studied under [Satoshi Kon](https://anilist.co/staff/99580/) on [JoJo's Bizarre Adventure](https://anilist.co/anime/666/), [Perfect Blue](https://anilist.co/anime/437/) and [Millenium Actress](https://anilist.co/anime/1033/).
